variant.question: Who issues the certificate of airworthiness?

options.text: State of registry
ICAO
Operator
State of design.

variant.question: When letters are used for the registration mark, combinations shall not be used which might be confused with the

options.text: five letter combinations used in the international code of signals.
three letters combinations used in the international code of signals.
letters used for an ICAO identification documents.
four letter combinations beginning with Q.

variant.question: When letters are used for registration mark, a combination that can be used and which should not be confused with other signals, would be for example

options.text: VOR
TTT
QNH
SOS

variant.question: A scheduled flight from Singapore to Thailand has the right to fly over Malaysia WITHOUT landing, and to land in Malaysia for non-traffic purposes. These rights are granted by the _____ Freedoms of the Air:

options.text: First and Second.
Third and Fourth.
First and Fifth.
Second and Third.

variant.question:
Contracting States shall not require the authorized agent or pilot-in-command to deliver to the public authorities concerned, before departure of the aircraft, more than some copies of General Declaration, Cargo Manifest and stores list
The numbers of the copies are

options.text: 3 of each.
2 copies of General Declaration and of Cargo Manifest and of a stores list.
2 of each.
2 copies of General Declarations and Cargo Manifest and one copy of a simple stores list.

variant.question: The minimum specifications for a crew license to have international validity is contained in:

options.text: Annex 1.
Annex 2.
Annex 10.
Annex 4.

variant.question: International Air Services Transit Agreement – The First Freedom of the Air defined in the International Air Services Transit Agreement is the..

options.text: right to overfly another State without landing.
privilege to operate a commercial flight with passengers on board between two States.
right to carry passengers from the State in which the aircraft is registered an other State.
right to land for a technical stop in another State.

variant.question: An aircraft from an ICAO contracting State must carry the following documents on an international flight:

options.text: C of A, certificate of registration, appropriate licences of each crew member and the aircraft's radio station licence
C of A, certificate of registration, appropriate licences of each crew member and log books of flight deck crew members
Appropriate licences of each crew member, C of A, certificate of registration and passports of each crew member
Crew member licences, C of A, certificate of registration and receipts for all fuel purchased outside the aircraft's own State

variant.question: When should the AIS be avaliable for a flight?

options.text: At least the entire flight AND plus 2 hour BEFORE and AFTER the flight
At least the entire flight AND plus 30 Mins BEFORE and AFTER the flight
At least the entire flight
No requirement for it to be available

variant.question: In accordance with ICAO Annex 1, when a contracting state renders valid a licence issued by another contracting state, the validity of the authorisation

options.text: shall not extend beyond the period of validity of the licence.
shall not extend beyond one year for ATPL and CPL.
is only considered for PPL.
depends on the regulations of the Contracting State which renders valid the licence.

variant.question: Facilitation  General Declaration  If the State requires crew member`s information to be included in the General Declaration, which information should be required?

options.text: The crew name.
The date of birth.
The place of birth.
The licence number.

variant.question: What is the PART-FCL definition of 'night'?

options.text: The hours between the end of evening civil twilight and the beginning of morning civil twilight.
From 30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes after sunrise.
The hours when the sun is below the horizon.
The hours of darkness.

variant.question: Who is responsible for investigation if an accident happened in a non-contracting state?

options.text: The state of registry.
EASA.
ICAO.
The closest state.

options.text: Domestic air services
A flight above territorial waters
Crop spraying
A national air carrier

variant.question: The term "Cabotage" refers to:

options.text: domestic air services.
international air services.
a flight above territorial waters.
the transport of dangerous goods.

variant.question: Which of the following combinations of letters may be used for registration marks?

options.text: VOR
SOS
TTT

variant.question: The ICAO annex which deals with entry and departure of cargo and other articles on international flights is

options.text: Annex 9.
Annex 15.
Annex 8.
Annex 16.

variant.question: According ICAO Annex 13, a contracting state is obligated to investigate an accident/incident

options.text: within its state but not over high seas.
within states which are cooperating with EASA.
within its state and over high seas.
everywhere.

variant.question: An aircraft is flying from the USA to Germany. Overhead the UK, the pilot is told that he/she is no longer allowed to enter Germany. All mentioned countries signed the International Aviation Convention. This situation is...

options.text: legal, because each contracting state has the right of sovereignty over its own airspace.
legal, because the US is not part of EASA.
illegal, because they signed the convention and therefore are obliged to permit the aircraft to land.
illegal, because a permission to enter cannot be withdrawn once given.

variant.question: Contracting States shall provide search and rescue services within their territories

options.text: on a 24-hour basis.
from 06:00 until 24:00 local time.
during the day-light period.
during the period established in the Regional Air Navigation Agreement.

variant.question: One of the duties of Contracting States is to make sure that the following documents are carried on board of an aircraft:

options.text: Certificate of registration, certificates of airworthiness, licences of personnel, recognition of certificates and licences
Certificate of registration, certificates of airworthiness, recognition of certificates and licences
Certificate of registration, certificates of airworthiness, licences of personnel
Certificate of registration, certificates of airworthiness

variant.question: What is a customs airfield?

options.text: An airport where every aircraft which enters the territory of a given state shall land for the purpose of customs and other examination.
Airfields fitted with the appropriate low visibility operations equipment.
Any regional airport.
An airport where the customs services are provided by civil officers.

variant.question: You are flying from Italy to Libya. According to SERA, what rules must you follow when crossing the Mediterranean?

options.text: Annex 2
Libya Rules
High Seas
Italian Rules

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 2, Rules of the Air, which of the following statements correctly describes a time check? This shall be obtained

options.text: prior to operating a controlled flight and at such other times during the flight as may be necessary.
after take-off when passing the first required position report.
prior to operating a controlled flight; it can be requested from Air Traffic Control only on the ground.
after take-off prior to making the first required position report; it can be requested from Air Traffic Control and will be given to the nearest whole minute.

variant.question: The ICAO Contracting States establish border controls for the entry and departure of persons Regarding the entry requirements for crew arriving on duty on an international flight,

options.text: States shall establish measures to expedite inspection of crew members and their baggage.
States shall ensure that the Flight Crew Licence is accepted as a valid document of identity.
crew members are subject to the same entry requirements as passengers.
crew must be in uniform in order to be allowed temporary entry into the Contracting State.

variant.question: One of the following statements about aircraft ground movement is correct

options.text: A taxiing aircraft has priority over a vehicle towing an aircraft.
Two airplanes approaching head-on will alter course to the left.
An aircraft overtaking another does so by passing on the right.
A vehicle towing an aircraft has priority over a taxiing aircraft.

variant.question: Air navigation services over high seas are provided...

options.text: by a contracting state who has accepted the responsibility of provision of such services.
by the regional ICAO office closest to such area.
by delegation, US over Atlantic, Russia over Arctic, Australia over Pacific.
by the member state closest to such area.

variant.question: An aircraft flying over the territory of another State must:

options.text: follow the Rules of the air of the State it is overflying.
follow the Rules of the air of the State that has issued the aircraft certificate of airworthiness.
follow the Rules of the air of the State of the Operator.
follow the Rules of the air of the State of Registration.

variant.question: What does the International Air Transport Agreement provide for?

options.text: The carriage of traffic between the state of registration of the aircraft and any other participating state.
The freedom for aeroplanes to fly over the territory of any other State without landing.
The freedom for aeroplanes of one State to land in the territory of another State for the purpose of refuelling.
Free and unhindered transit of aeroplanes over the high seas.

variant.question: Chicago Convention - Contracting States have the obligation to inform ICAO about;

options.text: differences and / or deviations from the standards with the Annexes to the Convention.
the pricing policy and agreements for passengers and goods in international air traffic.
all changes in their national regulations.
new licences and ratings for flight crew and ground personnel and any suspended validity of such licences.

options.text: Tokyo
Montreal 1 999

operations undertaken with military aircraft.

options.text: Rome
Chicago
Paris

options.text: Authority of the State in which the accident occurred.
aircraft manufacturer.
operators of the same type of aircraft.

variant.question: When an aircraft crashes in an area not owned by a certain state who is responsible for carrying out SAR activities?

options.text: The state of registry.
The state of the operator.

variant.question: Which of the following correctly states services provided and requirements for VFR flights in Class E airspace?

options.text: Traffic information as far as practical and ATC clearance is not required.
Traffic information as far as practical and ATC clearance is required.
Air traffic control service and ATC clearance is not required.
Air traffic control service and ATC clearance is required.

variant.question: According to ICAO Doc 7300/9 Convention on International Civil Aviation, Article to ‘’Landing at customs airport’’, what statement is correct?

options.text: Aircraft are permitted to cross the territory of a Contracting State without landing, unless the regulations of that State require you to land for customs examination.
Aircraft from another Contracting State may land at a non-designated customs airport for the purpose of re-fuelling and then continue to another Contracting State.
Particulars of all designated customs airports shall be published by the State and transmitted to the International Air Transport Association (IATA).
Aircraft departing from one Contracting State to another Contracting State may depart from a non-customs airport provided that the destination airport has customs facilities.

To the sate of manufacture

options.text: binding for the member States that have not notified ICAO about a national difference.
binding for all airline companies with international traffic.
binding for all member States.

variant.question: A publication issued by or with the authority of a State and containing aeronautical information of a lasting character essential to air navigation is the definition of

options.text: aeronautical Information Publication (AIP).
NOTAM.

variant.question: Facilitation  Entry and departure of persons  Which of the following documents shall be considered in all Contracting States as a valid and acceptable identity document?

options.text: A valid passport with valid visas where appropriate.
A seafarers` identity document.
A resident alien card.
A national identity card.

variant.question: Which state shall ensure that there exists a continuing structural integrity program to ensure the airworthiness of aeroplanes above 5 700 kg?

options.text: State of design.
State  of the operator.
The state of registry or the state of the operator.
State of registry.

variant.question: The State of Design shall ensure that, there exists a continuing structural integrity program to ensure the airworthiness of the aeroplane, which includes specific information concerning corrosion prevention and control, in respect of aeroplanes

options.text: over 5 700 kg maximum certified Take-off Mass.
up to 5 700 kg maximum certified Take-off and Landing Mass.
up to 5 700 kg maximum certified Take-off Mass.
over 5 700 kg maximum certified Take-off and Landing Mass.

variant.question: Clearances will contain which of the items specified below?

options.text: Aircraft identification, clearance limit, route of flight, level of flight.
Aircraft identification, clearance limit, initial heading of flight, level of flight.
Aircraft identification, route of flight, level of flight or changes of levels if required.
Aircraft identification, clearance limit, track and headings of the route of flight, level of flight.

variant.question: Define the term 'cross-country flight':

options.text: A flight between a point of departure and a point of arrival following a pre-planned route, using standard navigation procedures.
A flight leg between a point of departure and a point of arrival within controlled airspace.
A flight of at least 25 NM between a point of departure and a point of arrival following a pre-planned route, using standard navigation procedures.
A flight between two different airfields covering a distance of at least 50 NM.

options.text: Damage caused by foreign aircraft to third parties on the surface.

the State of Design.

options.text: International Civil Aviation Organisation.

options.text: in Annex 2 of the Chicago Convention.
in Part FCL.
by the State through whose airspace the aircraft last flew.

options.text: may be requested by contracting state
includes cargo and airway bill.
should always be provided.

options.text: Rome Convention 1933/1952.

variant.question: ICAO Annex 12 is applicable to which geographical areas?

options.text: Over the territories of Contracting States and over the high seas.

options.text: Annexes to the Convention on international civil aviation.
ICAO Technical Manuals.
